intro: Aconitum vulparia subsp. pantocsekianum, commonly known as the Hungarian monkshood, is a member of the Ranunculaceae family. It is native to the Carpathian Mountains and is characterized by its striking blue-violet flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forests and meadows. It has palmately lobed leaves and produces showy, hood-shaped blooms. Due to its toxicity, it should be handled with care.
